headline: Insuring Against an Oracle Default Is Getting Costlier. Is It a Bad Omen for AI?
summary: As  Oracle  pours money into artificial intelligence, investors are finding it more and more expensive to insure against a potential AI meltdown.  The price of  Oracle’s  five-year credit default swaps hit their highest point in more than two years earlier this month and now sit just below that peak.  A credit default swap acts as insurance for corporate debt, with the buyer receiving a payout if the company can’t repay its bonds.
